ResponseEnum.Value: Endpoint list full, device not provisioned
Command not valid yet, need initialization
No response from HAN module (used internally by M16C)"
Service discovery for the requested HAN device is not complete.

SendCommand.Notes: The HAN module ships without a network. In order to perform any HAN operations, a network must first be commissioned. The FOCUS AX HAN FW allows the host system to actively manage HAN assignment by specifying the channel (11-26) and the HAN ID (1-65534) or allows the FOCUS AX HAN FW to randomly assign the channel and HAN ID. The channel and HAN ID are BOTH either actively or randomly assigned. I should be noted that in an installed environment the channel and HAN ID should be randomly assigned by the FW in order to minimize the possibility of neighboring Home Area Networks interfering with one another. The ability to actively assign specific channels and HAN IDs is retained mostly for development and demonstration purposes.Channel = 0x00 to randomly assign channel.HAN ID = 0x0000 to randomly assign HAN ID.XHANID=0x0000000000000000 to randomly assign XHANID

This command tells all connected devices to leave the HAN then removes all information about any devices that previously existed on the HAN then removes the network from the HAN module. HAN RF is disabled when no HAN exists on the module.

Returns the network channel and HAN ID. If no HAN is commissioned, the channel returned will be 0xEE and the HAN ID will be 0xFFFF which are both invalid values and indicate that no network is present. Beginning at release 065504-01.05.00, the request HAN parameters response includes additional bytes to specify the extended HANID (XHANID).Channel = 0xEE and HAN ID of 0xFFFF means no HAN is present (Beginning at release 065504-01.05.00, XHANID of 0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF also indicates no HAN is present).

Returns the number of devices on the HAN followed by all of the information required for the host to manage the device list. The FOCUS AX HAN FW will return the following for each device on the HAN: Short ID – a unique 16 bit address for a HAN device used by the FOCUS AX HAN FW to communicate with the HAN device. Device type – application device type as defined by reference 1. Cluster client support bitmap – a bitmap that indicates which clusters are supported as clients on the HAN device. MAC address – 64 bit MAC address of the HAN device.

This command replaces the functionality of the discontinued (after 065504-01002007) request device list command ant returns the number of devices on the HAN followed by the short ID for each device on the HAN: Short ID – a unique 16 bit address for a HAN device used by the FOCUS AX HAN FW to communicate with the HAN device.

SendCommand.Description: Request HAN device information - MAC address
SendCommand.Notes: The FOCUS AX HAN FW will return the index of the device in the application node list, the number of HAN devices on the network and the following for the specified device: Short ID – a unique 16 bit address for a HAN device used by the FOCUS AX HAN FW to communicate with the HAN device. Device type – application device type as defined by reference 1. Cluster client support bitmap – a bitmap that indicates which clusters are supported as clients on the HAN device.

SendCommand.Description: Request HAN device information - Short ID
SendCommand.Notes: The FOCUS AX HAN FW will return the index of the device in the application node list, the number of HAN devices on the network and the following for the specified device: Short ID – a unique 16 bit address for a HAN device used by the FOCUS AX HAN FW to communicate with the HAN device. Device type – application device type as defined by reference 1. Cluster client support bitmap – a bitmap that indicates which clusters are supported as clients on the HAN device.

This command provides the FOCUS AX HAN FW with the MAC address and the temporary link key of a device that is expected to join the HAN in the future. This command also specifies to the FOCUS AX HAN FW a time (1-30 days) that the device will be allowed to join. If the in home device being provisioned is the first device being provisioned on the HAN, this command will commission a network. If a HAN is already present on the meter, the network commissioning step will be skipped by the FW and the in home device will be provisioned. Once the expected device joins and completes service discovery, a Gridstream network event will be generated to indicate that the device is now fully registered on the HAN. The event will contain all of the necessary information that the host needs to uniquely describe the device (short ID, cluster client support bitmask, device type (as defined reference 1), and MAC address). Another Gridstream network event will be generated once the joining window closes. The joining window currently stays open for the entire duration specified, even after the device joins.
This command tells all connected devices to leave the HAN then removes all information about the HAN devices from module without decommissioning the network.

This command tells the specified HAN device to leave the HAN, then removes the specified HAN device from the application node list. The HAN device is targeted by specifying its short ID. In releases newer than 065504-01.05.02, a HAN device can be targeted for removal by IEEE EUI64 (MAC) address.

This command tells the specified HAN device to leave the HAN, then removes the specified HAN device from the application node list. The HAN device is targeted by specifying its short ID. In releases newer than 065504-01.05.02, a HAN device can be targeted for removal by IEEE EUI64 (MAC) address.

ResponseToCommandWAN.Notes:
Network commission response codes: 0x70 – Invalid call 0x8A – Invalid channel 0x95 – Invalid security level 0xA8 – Security not initialized 0xA7 –Master key not set
Device provisioning response codes: 0x03 – Endpoint list full, device not provisioned 0x04 – Device is already provisioned 0x70 – Invalid call
